page.title: 14A VILLAGE MUM'S DAY - 2
page.content: It's nearly 9 a.m. and the children, ready for school, are playing outside while I peg out the washing. At 8.55 it's time to check for dinner money, reading books, crisps and recorders. Everything is in order and off we go.{ Though{Haresfield}village is quite small, the road at this time is very busy and I like to take the children over it. After standing in the playground for a short time, it's goodbye until 3 p.m. I like to start the housework as soon as I get in but can't decide whether to work indoors or out. The arrival of a friend solves the problem for we have coffee. After she leaves, the dog keeps looking at me and I decide to take her into the fields before it gets too hot. She is pleased that I am picking up her lead. We go through the orchard and onto the barley field.
